text: What do we think of the new ghost quarter?
bad for commander?
I have a head cold so my brain is damp cotton
Good later in the game, bad early?

For reference

Field of Ruin
Land - - - Uncommon
T: Add C to your mana pool.
2,T, sacrifice ~: Destroy target nonbasic land an opponent controls. Each player searches his or her library for a basic land card, puts it onto the battlefield, then shuffles his or her library.
254/279
I like it. I don't think it's "good" though
When it's just two of you it's probably worth two mana to get your own land, and it's untapped so it's net -1 that turn for net +1 future turns when compared to Ghost Quarter
Yeah, there's just too many other options.
ramping two players just to get rid of a problem land really isn't good enough.
Doesn't help that Wasteland is not many reprintings away from being a 10 dollar card
maybe if your playing a deck with [[Mindlock Orb]] or the other types it could be playable

text: The Golden City sure looks like Kaladesh...
#returntokaladesh ?
She tried planeswalking there and got bounced back to it.
Seems strange she would walk there of all the planes in the multiverse.
Perhaps the sun thingy is an artifact from Kaladesh?
It's probably because the art parallels of Huatli's character with the freedom of expression Kaladesh champions
Planeswalkers have historically jumped to a plane that makes sense for them thematically
I like that Ix feels big. Amonkhet and Kaladesh felt confined to a few square blocks of one city
Innistrad kinda did too. I like the adventure world feel of this so far. If only Jace wasn't there to eventually bring chaos and destruction
And flair...he brings lots of deadly flair...

The first Innistrad felt huge. The second one did kind of feel like we were investigating a murder in a single town, instead of traveling the entire plane to figure out why the mortal realm was headed to hell
Well this should be fun...
That could fit into a curse deck...
